i should probably mention the server is behind a router that forwards the ports 22 and 80 to the server which has static ip address... this could be a bad approach but it used to work.
IdleOne i tried to ping the router (the server has only local ip)
I use the same setup here and it works fine
Yes, it would help if the router had icmp enabled (ping reply)

Another thing which is sometimes a problem is that some "hackers" try to brute-force attack on known ports, so the box could just be overloaded with this at times. You should change the port that sshd runs on to something oddball and then forward that port instead
thanks for the advice. so in any case it's the router settings that need to be altered?

Well, it is good to be able to turn it on and off for diagnostic purposes for instance. you may want to consider turning on the remote admin features of the router so you can access it over the internet. But I recommend again to put it on some oddball port number
